page.title: 05LOCAL ARTIST
page.content: Mrs. Savage, my Nan, has lived in Frodsham all her life and since retiring has devoted much time to painting china in her kitchen.She painted plates for her children, grandchildren and gradually got orders from others. Why paint local scenes? People asked for scenes of where they used to live, the church they were married in or views of their road long ago. Her plates are exported all over the world.Work is displayed in the Crest Hotel Runcorn, at craft fayres and she talks to many organisations. She has connections with the Lewis Carroll society, visitors to Daresbury often buying her "Alice" mementos. Unpainted plates are bought from Stoke on Trent or Germany.Special china powder paints are used, mixed to a fine paste and finally fired in her own kiln, most needing three firings.
